>
[Three-Section Naginata](/Weapons.aspx?ID=305)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Deadly d8" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=174" />
<trait label="Forceful" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=180" />
<trait label="Sweep" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=194" />
<trait label="Versatile B" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=200" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 30 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 12 gp

**Damage** 1d8 S

**Bulk** 2
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 2

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Category** Advanced

**Group** [Flail](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=7)
</row>

</column>

---

A fusion of a [naginata](/Weapons.aspx?ID=98) and [sansetsukon](/Weapons.aspx?ID=302), this three-section weapon has a sweeping, curved blade along each of the outer sections. Though difficult for anyone but an expert weapon master to use effectively, the three-section naginata can be wielded at devastating speed to slice or smash apart a foe.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-7" />
